intro: Sonerila quadrangularis, commonly known as the four-angle sonerila, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its quadrangular (four-sided) stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by bright red berries. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit.
